meanings.sent1: The ling swam gracefully in the clear water.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating ling because it is a tasty fish.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ling refuse to share its fishing spot? Because it was a selfish fish!
meanings.sent4: The ling moved through the water like a silver arrow.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman proudly displayed his catch of a large ling.

meanings.sent1: The ling plant added a pop of purple to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The heather ling bloomed beautifully in the spring.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ling plant always gossip? Because it was a nosy plant!

meanings.definition: A long, narrow strip of land.
meanings.sent1: The ling of grass stretched along the edge of the field.
meanings.sent2: We walked along the ling to reach the other side of the meadow.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ling of land feel lonely? Because it was separated from the rest of the field!
meanings.sent4: The ling of land seemed to connect the two sides of the meadow like a bridge.
meanings.sent5: The ling provided a clear path through the tall grass of the meadow.
